© IEOM Society International 
go over the purpose of the Python application, which is to link up with the Azure IoT hub, which acts as a bidirectional 
connector for IoT devices. The IoT hub will then perceive the incoming data and send it to Azure Stream analytics, 
which in this case will be in the form of a serialized JSON string. Azure Stream Analytics is a complex event-
processing engine and real-time analytics tool designed to analyze and manage massive amounts of rapidly flowing 
data from numerous sources simultaneously. Azure stream analytics will then divide the data, sending one portion to 
the Azure Machine learning workspace, which will use the heating, drying, and cutting system information to predict 
the coming temperature, perhaps resulting in boiler damage. To predict the next temperature, we will make use of the 
current deep learning model from the Azure machine learning studio. The stream analytics job will use this data to 
store in Azure SQL DB after this prediction is finished, and the data will then be displayed via the Power BI dashboard 
after Azure ML transmits the data back into stream analytics.  
A general understanding of the Azure stream analytics task is required before proceeding with this scenario. Input, 
query, and output are the three components that make up an Azure Stream Analytics task. Stream Analytics receives 
data from Azure Blob Storage, Azure Event Hubs, or Azure IoT Hubs. Streaming data can be effectively filtered, 
sorted, aggregated, and combined over time using the SQL query language-based query. The user has influence over 
what happens in reaction to the reviewed data, and each task contains one or more outputs for the altered data. Data 
can be sent to services like Azure Functions, for instance. Sending data to a Power BI dashboard will allow for real-
time dashboarding. 
 
5. Recommendation and Future Works 
Although the setup already provides real-time data in the dashboard, it would be ideal if it was possible to the 
anticipated outcome. It is possible to configure the dashboard to employ an OTP-based login method to secure the 
authentication procedure. VPN can be used to secure the website (a virtual private network). Last but not least, because 
Azure supports straightforward mobility and a standard platform, the complete implementation may be carried out 
utilizing the cloud framework (Researched Base Cloud System Architecture). In addition, Microsoft's pay-as-you-go 
model enables to only pay for the resources we use to build or enhance our applications using Azure services. The 
Azure Active Directory service's secure IAM (Identity and Access Management) capabilities, which let the right 
individuals access the right data, are what matter most. Also available on a single platform are all of the Azure cloud 
services, including Azure IoT, Power BI, Azure SQL DB, Azure stream analytics, and others. The aforementioned 
endeavor may have been much better if there had been more time. The prospectus's capacity to forecast the temperature 
and deliver notifications was one of its key features. 
 
6. Conclusion 
The aforementioned explanation shows that both conventional and modern architecture are able to address the 
aforementioned difficulty through speculative and practical solutions. The replacement of equipment is frequently a 
part of traditional production line maintenance operations in manufacturing, either after a failure or at predetermined 
intervals. Because of the equipment's frequent premature replacement, these maintenance programs frequently incur 
additional costs. These have a detrimental effect on the economy. Numerous studies are being conducted on it. None 
of them, though, are lasting. While mine is a long-term fix. Because of merging machine learning and data processing 
approaches. To evaluate and test the system's effectiveness and propensity for prediction, algorithms are used. They 
gather data in real time and deliver results. Additionally, there will be notifications and an automatic reset of the device. 
Therefore, it won't need to be watched over constantly, every day of the week. 
 
Additionally, it saves time and is effective rather than being expensive. For the management and automation of 
industrial activities, the Internet of Things (IoT) is essential. Companies are starting to rely more on technology than 
on manual labor as time goes on. It operates instantly. IoT has improved quality and boosted control over industrial 
activities. The manufacturing cycle can be carried out more quickly and economically by using different protocols. 
Therefore, we can categorically declare that an IoT-based dashboard is a must. As modernization's present and future, 
the Internet of Things (IoT).

Replacing PET Plastic With PLA As A Sustainable 
Alternative To Functional Drink Containers 
Camila Canturin, Alessandra Rojas and Rafael Villanueva 
Industrial Engineering Department 
Universidad de Lima 
Lima, Perú 
20200392@aloe.ulima.edu.pe, 20201838@aloe.ulima.edu.pe,  
rvillan@ulima.edu.pe  
Abstract 
Polyethylene terephthalate (PET) is a widely used material in container manufacturing, particularly in bottle 
production. It is characterized by its low cost and widespread availability. However, its improper disposal has 
significantly exacerbated global plastic pollution. For instance, less than 50% of plastic bottles are recycled. Moreover, 
studies indicate that this issue has led to a significant accumulation of plastic waste in the oceans, which continues to 
grow annually and could be considered floating islands of debris. This study proposes replacing PET with polylactic 
acid (PLA), a biodegradable and biocompatible polymer with suitable properties for bottle production. PLA also has 
a shorter decomposition time compared to PET, contributing to the reduction of carbon footprint and greenhouse gas 
emissions. The research methodology included a diagnostic phase to define objectives, identify constraints, and 
determine variables based on an extensive literature review. The design phase focused on modeling a PLA-based 
bottle with detailed specifications and innovative structural features. Additionally, experimental evaluations of 
biodegradability, compressive strength, and tensile strength were conducted to compare PET and PLA. The study 
incorporated technical standards and engineering protocols to evaluate critical properties such as material permeability 
and stress behavior. As a result, it was confirmed that PLA exhibits properties that make it a competitive material 
compared to PET. In conclusion, this research presents a technically viable alternative to PET bottles through the use 
of PLA, with the potential to significantly mitigate environmental impacts while maintaining the functional 
requirements of packaging. 
Keywords 
PLA, PET, Biodegradability, Bottle and Properties 
1. Introduction
The issue arising from global plastic production is its inadequate management. As evidence of this, only 20% of 
produced plastic bottles are recycled (Georgiou et al. 2022). Additionally, approximately 2.40 million tons of plastic 
waste are dumped into the ocean worldwide. According to Alhazmi, Almansour, and Aldhafeeri, this accumulation of 
2.40 million tons of waste in the ocean has led to the creation of “The Great Pacific Garbage Patch” (as cited in Ajaj 
et al. 2022, p. 5). Furthermore, due to the inadequate disposal of PET bottles and their long-term persistence, CO2 
emissions are generated, leading to respiratory problems and an increase in global warming. Additionally, ecosystems 
are deteriorating, aquatic and terrestrial organisms are impacted, mosquito reproduction is encouraged, and various 
diseases affecting public health are proliferating (Ajaj et al. 2022). To mitigate these environmental impacts, solutions 
such as “Smart Use of Materials” (Suarez et al. 2022) and “material efficiency” (Pomponi et al. 2022) have been 
proposed, focusing on the intelligent use of materials and improved packaging design. For this reason, it is proposed 
to replace PET with a biodegradable material suitable for beverage packaging, such as PLA.

Development of a Wiper and Sweeper Robot 
Md Mizanur Rahman, Mohammad Mashud, 
Enamul Hoq,& Md Shariful Islam 
Department of Mechatronics Engineering,  
Faculty of Science and Engineering  
World University of Bangladesh 
Avenue 06 Lake Drive, Sector 17H, Uttara,  
Dhaka, Bangladesh  
shariful.islam@mte.wub.edu.bd 
Abstract 
A new service robot is designed in this work for floor dust cleaning in home environments. System has three 
subsystems: electrical, software and mechanical of which microcontroller, sensors and motor are the electrical and 
mechanical subsystems respectively and the software subsystem is the brain of the robot. The cleaning robot uses a 
microcontroller to detect obstacles and manipulates its direction as per the inputs. It is programmed to accept inputs 
to sense obstacles around it and control the robot to avoid any collisions. In case of an obstacle, or a potential collision, 
the microcontroller controls the wheels of the robot by a motor driver to avoid collision. The Floor cleaner at the 
bottom of the robot performs the cleaning process. 
Keywords 
Dust cleaning robot, Software, Microcontroller, Sensors and Motors 
Acknowledgements 
The authors wish to thank their parents for all support. 
Biographies 
Prof. Dr. Md. Mizanur Rahman is a Professor of the Mechatronics Engineering Department, Faculty of 
Engineering at the World University of Bangladesh. He has research and teaching interests in both fundamental and 
applied aspects of energy technologies, particularly new technology to harvest electricity from solar power and 
hydropower. In 1999, he started his career at the RETs in Asia Phase II Project as a Research Engineer, working 
under the Department of Mechanical Engineering at Khulna University of Engineering and Technology (KUET) 
and Asian Institute of Technology (AIT) in Bangkok, Thailand. In 2005, he joined BRAC as a Programmed Support 
Specialist. Dr. Rahman was appointed Assistant Manager Technical at Rural Power Company Ltd. in 2006 and 
Lecturer at TAS Institute of Oil and Gas in 2009. Later on, Dr. Rahman moved to Universiti Malaysia Sabah as 
Senior Lecturer in 2012. I began my tenure as an Associate Professor in the Mechatronics Engineering Department 
at the World University of Bangladesh in January 2019, and received a promotion to Professor in March 2021. He 
is a Chartered Energy Engineer and CEng Member of the Institution of Mechanical Engineers (IMechE) and Energy 
Institute (EI), a Fellow, Institute of Engineers Bangladesh (IEB), Member, Bangladesh Society of Mechanical 
Engineers (BSME), American Society of Mechanical Engineering (ASME), and Professional Member, Institute of 
Materials Malaysia (IMM) and Society of Industrial Engineering and Operation Management (IEOM). 
Prof. Dr. Mohammad Mashud is a Professor in the Department of Mechanical Engineering at Khulna University 
of Engineering & Technology (KUET), Bangladesh. He was born in Dhaka, Bangladesh in 1975. He received his 
Ph.D. in Aerospace Engineering from Nagoya University, Japan in 2006. He also earned a Master of Engineering 
from the same department and university from Japan in 2003. He completed his Bachelor of Science in Engineering 
(Mechanical) from Khulna University of Engineering & Technology (KUET), Bangladesh. In 1999 he joined as a 
lecturer in the Department of Mechanical Engineering, KUET. He served as a Head of the Department of 
Mechanical Engineering, KUET for the duration of two years (2012-2013). He supervises research activities in the 
field of aerodynamics, UAV, fluid mechanics and energy sciences and teaches fluid mechanics and aerodynamics

An Investigation of Blockchain Technology and Supply 
Chain Flexibility as Complements to Supply Chain 
Integration and Performance: A Dynamic Capability View 
Nihal Rahman Raad, Palash Saha, Istiaqe Ahamed, Md.  
Omar Shadat Sarker, Ruhaniayth Bin Afsar 
Department of Industrial Engineering and Management 
Khulna University of Engineering & Technology 
Khulna-9203, Bangladesh 
nihalraad@gmail.com, palash@iem.kuet.ac.bd,  
istiaqeahamed09@gmail.com, mdomarshadatsarker@gmail.com, 
evanruhaniayth05@gmail.com  
Abstract 
The objective of this paper is to explore the timing and methods by which organizations adopt blockchain technology 
(BT) to enhance both supply chain integration (SCI) and overall supply chain performance. The study grounded its 
theoretical framework in the dynamic capabilities perspective. Employing a quantitative methodology, data collection 
involved a structured questionnaire administered to a sample of 160 participants from various manufacturing firms in 
Bangladesh. To evaluate the formulated hypotheses, Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) analysis was performed 
using WarpPLS7.0 software. The results suggest a significant and positive effect of BT on both SCI and supply chain 
performance. Furthermore, the findings support the hypothesis that SCF plays a positive and significant moderating 
role in the relationship between BT and both SCI and supply chain performance. This study addresses a recognized 
gap in applying BT to enhance both supply chain integration and performance within a comprehensive context that 
includes the moderating role of supply chain flexibility. By demonstrating the positive effects of BT, organizations 
can better understand how to leverage this technology to improve operational efficiency and competitive advantage. 
Keywords 
Blockchain, Dynamic capability view, Supply chain integration, Supply chain performance, and Supply chain 
flexibility 
1. Introduction
Supply chain management (SCM) plays a pivotal role in achieving competitive advantage by enhancing organizational 
productivity and profitability through integration with internal operations, suppliers, and customers. Modern supply 
chains are becoming increasingly competitive due to expanding worldwide business operations, technological 
improvements, changing client needs, and shorter product lifecycles. As a result, market demand has become 
increasingly unpredictable, highlighting the importance of effectively managing uncertainty within the supply chain. 
With the rise of omnichannel retailing and the increasing emphasis on customer-centricity, firms face the challenge 
of meeting diverse customer preferences and delivery expectations. In an era marked by extreme market volatility, the 
significance of supply chain integration (SCI) has been underscored as essential for firms to maintain their 
sustainability (Shi et al. 2023). SCI integrates fundamental practices essential for attaining elevated levels of supply 
chain performance (SCP). SCI can empower organizations to synchronize supply chain activities, merge production 
and resource planning, and engage in collaborative decision-making, thereby improving supply chain efficiency. 
Moreover, SCI facilitates real-time visibility and data-driven insights across the supply chain, enabling quicker 
167
conclusion:
Proceedings of the International Conference on Industrial Engineering and Operations Management, 
© IEOM Society International 
5.2 Proposed Improvements 
Based on the findings of this research, several key improvements can be recommended for organizations:  
Integration of IoT and Blockchain for Demand Forecasting and Inventory Management: The integration of Blockchain 
and the Internet of Things (IoT) provides sophisticated data-driven demand forecasting and real-time inventory 
management functionalities. This integration enables companies to oversee and enhance their inventory levels, 
minimizing stockouts and excess inventory. Adopting this methodology helps optimize just-in-time (JIT) inventory 
strategies and augment inventory turnover rates, resulting in more agile and effective supply chain operations. 
 
Improved Agility through Decentralized Decision-Making: The decentralized characteristics of blockchain facilitate 
swift decision-making in the supply chain. Companies can allocate decision-making power throughout the supply 
chain, enabling immediate modifications based on blockchain-validated information. This decentralization mitigates 
delays resulting from hierarchical bottlenecks, allowing enterprises to respond promptly to market fluctuations and 
disturbances. The capacity to execute data-driven, decentralized choices improves overall supply chain agility, 
enabling enterprises to more effectively match their operations with client requirements. 
 
Sustainability and Regulatory Compliance through Blockchain: Blockchain facilitates sustainability and regulatory 
compliance by providing transparent and verifiable documentation of environmental and ethical adherence, hence 
enhancing corporate social responsibility and sustainable SCM. Companies can utilize blockchain to trace and 
authenticate the sources of raw materials, assess the ecological effects of manufacturing processes, and guarantee 
compliance with sustainability standards. This bolsters brand equity, fosters stakeholder confidence, and guarantees 
adherence to international sustainability benchmarks. Blockchain facilitates transparency and auditability, allowing 
companies to showcase their dedication to ethical sourcing and environmental stewardship. 
 
6. Conclusion 
In summary, the objective of this research was to evaluate the correlation between (BT), (SCI), and (SCP). PLS-SEM 
was used to analyze data collected from a sample of 160 industrial enterprises located in Bangladesh. The Integration 
of BT into SCM has demonstrated significant promise in enhancing both integration and performance. When 
considering SCF, it becomes clear that blockchain’s impact varies and is influenced by how adaptable and responsive 
the SC is. As discussed in this paper, the connection between BT and SCM is complex, with a flexible supply chain 
potentially enhancing the advantages of blockchain integration. By utilizing blockchain’s core features of 
transparency, immutability, and decentralization in conjunction with a flexible supply chain framework, businesses 
can effectively navigate uncertainties, streamline operations, manage risks, and ultimately achieve superior outcomes 
in SCI and performance. 
  
6.1 Limitations and Future Work 
The study acknowledges limitations including BT evolving nature and companies’ limited experience in assessing its 
impact on supply chains. It relies on respondents’ perceptions, suggesting the need for larger samples, wider industry 
inclusion, and interviews for deeper insights. Future research could explore alternative theories and optimal conditions 
for BT integration. The study’s cross-sectional data raises potential for common method bias, recommending 
longitudinal designs for validity. Furthermore, it highlights the need to investigate BT’s integration with other Industry 
4.0 technologies for broader implications

Door Security Enhanced with RFID Module and 
Temperature Sensor 
Ayman Khan, Tarek Ahmed, Nazmul Hasan Nahid, Tajhim Ahammad Pranto, Sabbir 
Hossain
Mechanical and Production Engineering 
Ahsanullah University of Science and Technology 
Dhaka 1208, Bangladesh 
ayman.me.200108149 @aust.edu, tarek.me.200108144 @aust.edu, nazmul.me.200108135 
@aust.edu, tajhim.me.200108151 @aust.edu, sabbir.me.200108148@aust.edu
Abstract 
RFID door lock systems provide a secure and efficient solution for access control, surpassing traditional methods by 
incorporating advanced technology. This paper introduces a door locking system that combines RFID technology with 
temperature sensors to enhance security and efficiency. The system verifies the authenticity of RFID tags and measures 
temperature before allowing access, providing an additional layer of safety. While RFID systems are increasingly 
adopted in industries such as healthcare, food, logistics, and agriculture, challenges remain, including high costs and 
privacy concerns. Future developments in this field could include real-time monitoring, predictive maintenance, 
integration with the Internet of Things (IoT), and advanced data analytics. Overcoming these current challenges is 
essential for broader adoption and to fully unlock the potential of RFID systems in a wide range of industries, 
improving their functionality and ensuring they remain a trusted method for access control. 
Keywords:
IoT Connectivity, Authorization, User tags, MLX90614, RFID Technology. 
1.Introduction
The integration of RFID technology and temperature sensing has emerged as a promising solution for industries 
requiring the monitoring and secure handling of temperature-sensitive items. This paper presents a project aimed at 
designing and implementing a secure and efficient door locking system that utilizes RFID technology and a temperature 
sensor. The system offers increased security, convenience, and integration with temperature monitoring capabilities 
[Ma Naing 2019]. The system requires several components, including an Arduino UNO R3, RFID RC522 module, 
MLX90614 temperature sensor, LCD display, buzzer, IR sensor, servo motor, batteries, and jumper wires. These 
components collaborate to deliver a secure and efficient door access control solution, integrating RFID verification and 
temperature monitoring to enhance safety and functionality. 
179
conclusion:

optimal performance, highlighting the system's potential for enhanced security and efficient access control in various 
environments. 
6.Conclusion
The integration of RFID RC522 module with MLX90614 temperature sensor provides enhanced security and 
convenience for door access in temperature-sensitive environments. This system offers real-time temperature 
monitoring and RFID access control, despite challenges like higher cost, limited range, and potential malfunctions. 
Despite these issues, it holds promise for industries requiring secure and monitored access to temperature-sensitive 
items.

and Technology in Dhaka, Bangladesh. He is passionate about exploring the intricacies of engineering and aims to 
develop a comprehensive understanding of manufacturing techniques and production systems. Sabbir engages in 
various academic projects and research initiatives to connect theoretical knowledge with practical experience. He can 
be reached at sabbir.me.200108148@aust.edu.

Supply Chain Management Applying VSM, 5S and 
Standardized Work in an SME: A Case Study of an 
Apparel Manufacturing Company 
Piero Alonso Bonifaz Riojas 
Bachelor 
Facultad de Ingeniería y Arquitectura,  
Universidad de Lima, Perú  
20180253@aloe.ulima.edu.pe

Rafael Chavez Ugaz 
Research Professor 
Facultad de Ingeniería y Arquitectura,  
Universidad de Lima, Perú  
Rchavezu@ulima.edu.pe 
https://orcid.org/ 0000-0002-9450-0158 
Abstract 
After the SARS-CoV-2 virus, the textile and clothing industry faces new challenges in the links of the textile chain 
due to global uncertainty. Setting the view on Peru, the competitiveness of the sector is threatened by imports, 
which significantly reduce the market share of SMEs. The research aims to optimize the supply chain management 
of a peruvian textile sector SME. It is proposed to implement a management model that integrates Lean Tools and 
Production Planning in the company's supply chain. 5S is applied to the production link within the supply chain, 
as this philosophy focuses on waste reduction within the production process, while, for the rest of the links, VSM 
and Standardized Work are used, in such a way that it is possible to specify a single procedure deliver the necessary 
amount at the right time, eliminating inventory. The model is evaluated through the implementation of a pilot test 
in one of the activities of the process. As a result of the implementation of the proposal considerable improvements 
are obtained in the company that affect the key indicators: increase in the company's competitiveness through 
increased productivity (82.21%), reduction of fabric waste (15.71%) and a reduction in Lead Time (80%), keeping 
pace with market demand. 
Keywords 
Supply Chain, VSM, 5S, Standardized Work and SME’s. 
1. Introduction
After 2 years of economic stagnation due to SARS-CoV-2 the textile industry has suffered severe setbacks, 
impacting the economy of the companies in this sector. At the beginning of 2020, the textile industry faced the 
187
conclusion:

. The increase in costs negatively contributes to the NPV by 41.43%. Finally, the increase in productivity does not 
have a significant positive contribution to the improvement of the NPV; however, it is the only variable among 
the three that the company has direct control over and can work on to improve its performance. 
 
6. Conclusion 
As a result of this case study, it can be concluded that the proposed model, focused on the supply chain of a 
Peruvian textile SME and employing Lean Tools (specifically a combination of 5S, Value Stream Mapping, and 
Standardized Work), is suitable, coherent, and adequate to provide a solution to the problem of low 
competitiveness in the industry, optimizing its operations in search of better performance. In addition, it is 
concluded that productivity, Lead Time, percentage of material waste, and the Value Added Ratio are suitable 
indicators for measuring and comparing the company's performance before and after implementing the proposed 
improvements. 
 
The results of the initial evaluation indicated the underutilization of fabric, the presence of elements that hinder 
operations, scarce documentation, among others; concluding that the main problem of the company is the 
excessive amount of material and time waste, and the lack of initiative for its reduction, causing activities to be 
carried out at a much slower pace than required to meet market demand.By applying the proposal to a real system, 
it can be concluded that this method of verification provides much more precise and accurate information 
compared to a simulation with software and using historical data from the company as input. Subsequently, it is 
functionally validated that the application of Lean methods is successful, as evidenced by the optimization of 
performance indicators as well as the financial assessment of the investment.

Optimizing Manufacturing Processes and Production 
through the Strategic Use of additional Cutting Tools in 
Injection Molding Machine  
Zahid Ahsan, Mustafizur Rahman, Masud Rana, M.R. Sohel,  
Md. Mizanur Rahman 
Department of Mechatronics Engineering 
World University of Bangladesh 
Acenue 6 & Lake Drive Road, Sector: 17/H, Uttara, 
Dhaka – 1230 
E-mail: zahid.ahsan@mte.wub.edu.bd, mustafizur.rahman@mte.wub.edu.bd,
masud.ranamte@mte.wub.edu.bd, sohel.rana@mte.wub.edu.bd, 
mizanur.rahman@mte.wub.edu.bd,  
Abstract 
This study explores the effects of incorporating an additional automated cutting tool into injection molding machines 
to optimize manufacturing processes. A comparative analysis of production data collected over the period of two 
months from July (prior to the modification) and August (post-modification) reveals significant enhancements in 
efficiency and output. Initially, the total production time per frame was 34 seconds, which included 25 seconds for 
molding and 9 seconds for hand cutting. This meant that a maximum of 856 frames (or 13,786 string cords) could be 
produced each day. The manufacturing process integrated a major change with the addition of the automated cutting 
tool. A 36% increase in manufacturing efficiency was achieved with the automated cutting tool, which shortened the 
frame production time to 25 seconds and increased output to 1,153 frames (18,432 string cords). Key findings indicate 
that elimination of manual cutting contributes to greater consistency in product quality and reliability in operational 
performance while also saving time and money on labor. This research underscores the importance of process 
automation in modern manufacturing and the strategic application of additional cutting tools, showcasing the 
advancements not only improve output but also contribute to sustainable manufacturing practices by maximizing 
resource efficiency. 
Keywords 
Injection Molding, Cutting Tools, Manufacturing Processes, Increase productivity. 
1. Introduction
In the swiftly changing realm of manufacturing, optimizing manufacturing processes is crucial for sustaining 
competitiveness and improving operating efficiency. Injection molding, a prevalent method for manufacturing 
different components, is especially susceptible to process parameters and tooling methods. Manufacturers aiming to 
decrease expenses, enhance product quality, and expedite time-to-market find the strategic use of supplementary 
cutting tools in injection molding machines to be a viable solution (Raju, et al. 2018). This research article examines 
the impact of auxiliary cutting tools on the efficacy of injection molding operations. The conventional injection-
molding configuration predominantly depends on a singular set of tools for the formation and refinement of 
components. The difficulties of contemporary manufacturing requirements such as precise geometries, stringent 
tolerances, and varied material properties - present challenges that traditional tooling may not sufficiently resolve. The 
integration of supplementary cutting tools enhances flexibility in machining operations (Banerjee et al. 2020), 
202
conclusion:
Proceedings of the International Conference on Industrial Engineering and Operations Management 
© IEOM Society International 
 
4.5 Analysis of the Comparison Data 
Time Efficiency: The removal of the manual cutting process decreased the overall time per frame by 26.5%. Despite 
the molding time being constant at 25 seconds, the elimination of the 9-second cutting step significantly enhanced the 
overall efficiency of the operation. 
 
Production Rate Enhancement: The daily output of frames rose by 36%, from 856 frames to 1,153 frames. This led to 
a comparable rise in the manufacturing of string cords, from 13,786 units daily to 18,432 units daily. The increased 
production rate is directly linked to the optimized process, wherein frames were molded and cut concurrently inside 
the same cycle. 
 
Work and Cost Efficiency: Before the alteration, physical work was necessary for the cutting process. By automating 
this process, the corporation decreased labor expenses and mitigated the risk of human mistake, which had hitherto 
resulted in discrepancies in cutting time. The enhanced uniformity in manufacturing also led to increased productivity 
and less downtime. 
 
The data analysis indicates that incorporating the cutting tool directly into the injection molding process led to 
substantial enhancements in time efficiency and manufacturing output. The removal of the manual cutting procedure 
resulted in a 26.5% reduction in time per frame, which in turn facilitated a 36% enhancement in daily production. The 
daily production of string cords rose from 13,786 to 18,432 
 
5.Results and Discussion 
The inclusion of an automated cutting tool into the injection molding machine has demonstrated a substantial 
enhancement in production efficiency and output, in contrast to the prior system that depended on manual cutting. A 
comprehensive review of the production data gathered over two months, July (before the alteration) and August (after 
the modification), revealed a significant rise in both the daily frame production and the overall string cord output. 
Injection molding took 25 seconds per frame before modification, and hand cutting added 9 seconds. The plant could 
only produce 856 frames per day (13,786 string cords) because to the 34-second frame manufacturing time. Manual 
cutting also reduced production due to operator efficiency. The mold’s cutting tool was incorporated after the 
alteration, eliminating the need for manual cutting. Production time per frame was cut to 25 seconds to match frame 
molding. This simplified procedure raised daily output to 1,153 frames, or 18,432 string cords. This boosts 
manufacturing efficiency by 36%. Key findings include: 
 
Reduction of time: From 34 to 25 seconds every frame. 
Increase of output: String cord manufacturing grew from 13,786 to 18,432 pieces per day, a gain of 4,646 pieces. 
Elimination of manual cutting: Eliminating manual cutting saves time, labor expenses, and manufacturing uniformity. 
The injection molding machine with an integrated cutting tool has increased productivity and efficiency. Removal of 
the time-consuming manual cutting phase optimized the production process, increasing productivity, lowering labor 
costs, and improving operational dependability. The judicious deployment of new production tools boosted 
productivity and showed the importance of process automation in manufacturing. 
 
      6. Conclusion 
The integration of sophisticated cutting tools into the injection molding process signifies a crucial enhancement in 
production efficiency and product quality. This study demonstrates that automating the cutting step markedly 
decreases production time and personnel expenses, while enhancing output and uniformity. Eliminating manual 
involvement enables businesses to optimize operations, reduce human error, and attain greater precision—essential 
elements in the current competitive production environment. 
 
During the two-month trial, the results revealed a significant 26.5% decrease in production time per frame, resulting 
in a 36% enhancement in daily string cord output. This acceleration illustrates the revolutionary capacity of 
automation, particularly in industries requiring complex, high-quality plastic components. By transitioning from 
manual to automated cutting processes, businesses meet the increasing need for expedited production cycles while 
maintaining precision and quality.

Industry 4.0-based AI Imperatives for E-Waste 
Management in Emerging Economies: A Pathway to 
Environmental Sustainability
Shoyeb Muhammad*, Ahanaf AL Niyaz, Afrin Sultana,  
Razoan Islam Zihad, Mustafizur Rahman, Md. Sumon Rahman,  
S M Sayeed Anowar, Rakesh Roy and 
Sarojit Kumar Biswas 
Department of Industrial and Production Engineering 
Jashore University of Science and Technology 
Jashore-7408, Bangladesh 
s.muhammad@just.edu.bd, 190715.ipe@student.just.edu.bd, afrin30601@gmail.com,
razoanislamzihad@gmail.com, m.rahman@just.edu.bd, sumon.just16@gmail.com,
sayeedanowar.just@gmail.com, rakeshroy996@gmail.com, sarojitipe@gmail.com
Ashik Adnan 
Graduate School of Science and Technology 
Gunma University 
Kiryu, Gunma, Japan 
t231b601@gunma-u.ac.jp  
Abstract 
The recent enormous expansion of the electronic industry and the extensive use of digital devices in this Industry 4.0 
era have affected e-waste management significantly, particularly for emerging economies. Implementing artificial 
intelligence (AI) based technologies is imperative to modernize conventional e-waste management systems and 
guarantee commercial viability and environmental sustainability. Therefore, this study aims to discover, evaluate, and 
rank the I4.0-based AI-improved for sustainable e-waste management systems. A blended approach consisting of the 
Delphi and Best-Worst Method (BWM) was combined to satisfy the objectives. Based on the experts' suggestions and 
extensive literature review, nine I4.0-based AI imperatives were screened out and prioritized using BWM to evaluate 
their relative importance. The result uncovered that “Sustainability-Centered Product Design to Minimize E-Waste” 
is the most applicable I4.0-based imperative, followed by “Blockchain and IoT Enabled Intelligent E-Waste Collection 
and Traceability” for smartly improving the e-waste management system. The insights of this research can be helpful 
for the industry's top executives, practitioners, and other stakeholders in dealing with e-waste management in an 
intelligent and long-lasting manner in this Industry 4.0 era. 
Keywords 
e-waste management, Industry 4.0, AI, Sustainability, Smart Waste Handling, Delphi, BWM

Social Media's Impact on Stock Market Volatility: A 
Systematic Review of Machine Learning models for 
Prediction and Optimization 
Asir Mubasshir Ishrak, Tasfia Islam Tinni, Samiha Mumtaj  
and Monisha Rani Dey 
Industrial and Production Engineering Department 
Military Institute of Science and Technology 
Dhaka, Bangladesh 
mubasshirishrak2000@gmail.com, tasfiaislamtinni02@gmail.com, 
samihamumtaj911@gmail.com, dey.monisha.r@gmail.com  
Supervised by: Lecturer Basit Mahmud Shahriar 
Industrial and Production Engineering Department 
Military Institute of Science and Technology 
Dhaka, Bangladesh 
basit.mahmud.mist@gmail.com 
Abstract 
Social media is instantaneous information exchange whereby news, opinions, and rumors can easily spread and 
immediately affect investor behavior and market patterns. Therefore, research in the impact of social media on the 
stock market volatility, such as those based on Twitter, Reddit, and Facebook, is indeed much needed. This literature 
review presented the in-depth study of social media activity and stock market volatility, emphasizing the role of 
sentiment analysis and predictive modeling in financial markets. This paper intends to complete the crucial research 
lacuna by investigating different social media platforms other than Twitter and Reddit, especially during big global 
events like the COVID-19 pandemic. The methodological approach will be a combination of a systematized literature 
review and selection based on comprehensive keyword searches in Google Scholar, Research Gate, and Web of 
Science. According to the analysis, it would appear that models using Naïve Bayes, XGBoost, and Random Forests, 
combined with sentiment analysis such as VADER and GARCH, can yield rather good predictions concerning short-
term movements in the stock market. However, many of the studies are burdened with a number of limitations, 
including the short period of data collected and their reliance on a single social media platform. By weighing both the 
advantages and disadvantages of social media, we contribute to insights of more accurate predictive models and point 
out further directions of research-most of all regarding refined techniques of sentiment analysis and nonlinear effects 
of social media on the market dynamics. Also, the need for multi-platform and cross-cultural studies should be 
emphasized. 
Keywords 
Social Media, Stock Market Volatility, Machine Learning, Sentiment Analysis. 
225

Data Preprocessing and Deep Learning Model for

Min Jei Park 
Department of Battery-Smart Factory 
College of Engineering,Korea University 
Seoul, Republic of Korea 
minjei_park@korea.ac.kr 
Haneul Kim, Hyung Ju Kim, Taesu Cheong* 
School of Industrial and Management Engineering 
College of Engineering,Korea University 
Seoul, Republic of Korea 
{rgs6827, hjkim1013, tcheong}@korea.ac.kr 
Jong Ug Jeon 
Department of Research Planning 
Korea University 
Seoul, Republic of Korea 
kokasin@korea.ac.kr 
Nam Jeon 
Real-scale Fire Testing & Research Center 
Fire & Disaster Management Division 
Korea Conformity Laboratories 
Gangwon-do, Republic of Korea 
jn93@kcl.re.kr 
Abstract 
The accurate detection of arc faults is critical for ensuring system safety and reliability, particularly in complex 
electrical networks. In this study, we propose a deep learning model that leverages advanced preprocessing techniques, 
including time-series data transformation into images, to enhance the detection capabilities. By utilizing methods such 
as Continuous Wavelet Transform (CWT) and deep convolutional neural networks (CNNs), our approach captures 
both temporal and frequency-domain features of voltage signals. We applied this model to real-world voltage data, 
focusing on abnormal event detection such as arc faults. The results demonstrate the model's ability to accurately 
classify normal and abnormal voltage patterns with significant precision, showcasing the potential for enhanced fault 
detection in power systems. Our findings suggest that this method could contribute to improved fault prediction and 
maintenance in various industrial applications. 
Keywords 
arc fault detection, anomaly detection, time-series data, signal processing, deep learning

Optimization of Ready-Mix Concrete Operations: A 
Comprehensive Approach Through Practical and 
Simulation-Oriented Data 
Jubayer Rahman Jamal 
Department of Industrial & Production Engineering 
Rajshahi University of Engineering & Technology 
Rajshahi-6204, Bangladesh 
jubayerrahmanjamal8807@gmail.com 
Mehedi Hasan 
Department of Mechanical Engineering 
Rajshahi University of Engineering & Technology 
Rajshahi-6204, Bangladesh 
1902081@student.ruet.ac.bd 
A M Almas Shahriyar Azad, Moudud Ahmad,Md. 
Sazol Ahmmed 
Department of Industrial & Production Engineering 
Rajshahi University of Engineering & Technology 
Rajshahi-6204, Bangladesh 
aaaarnab1234@gmail.com,moudud.ruet@gmail.com 
sazolahmmed1@gmail.com 
Abstract 
In order to improve operational efficiency, this study assesses the impact of batch preparation time in the 
manufacturing and distribution of ready-mix concrete (RMC) over several construction sites. By means of Arena 
software, the study intends to find delays, inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and variations in the RMC preparation and 
delivery process by juxtaposing empirical data with simulated results. Based on thorough data collected over a 30-day 
period, simulations indicate an average delivery time of 4.78 hours, while empirical data reveals an average of 8.30 
hours, so producing a 42% discrepancy. This notable difference shows that present site operations are less effective 
than the ideal simulation, hence stressing the need for improvements in particular fields. Using a root cause analysis, 
one has been able to identify elements causing delays, including inefficiencies in batch preparation or delivery 
systems, which influence general performance. Based on the results, the paper presents a framework meant to improve 
the efficiency of concrete delivery systems, reducing delays and optimizing operations. The suggestions seek to 
improve the operational flow of the ready-mix concrete plant, clear obstacles, and offer a more accurate portrayal of 
actual conditions in replicated models. This study is important since it improves RMC delivery methods, increases the 
efficiency of building site management, and builds a scalable framework relevant to many different worldwide sectors. 
230
conclusion:
Proceedings of the International Conference on Industrial Engineering and Operations Management,  
 
 
Figure 8. A proposed framework to mitigate unwanted delays by robust logistics activities 
 
6. Conclusion  
The aim of this study, to assess and enhance the efficiency of batch preparation and distribution of ready-mix concrete 
(RMC), has been successfully achieved. The study revealed substantial discrepancies between real-world data and 
Arena simulation outcomes, with actual delivery times averaging 8.30 hours, which is 42% longer than the simulated 
4.78 hours. Root cause analysis revealed inefficiencies, including VAT processing delays, internet connectivity 
problems, and logistical challenges.The suggested framework and recommendations, encompassing enhancements to 
VAT administration, labor coordination, and logistics management, provide practical measures to optimize operations 
and minimize delays. These interventions are anticipated to improve plant efficiency, reduce delivery bottlenecks, and 
better synchronize simulation with real-world outcomes.  
 
The research highlights the necessity of incorporating GPS tracking and centralized management systems for real-
time decision-making, markedly decreasing operational inefficiencies and enhancing customer satisfaction. Future 
endeavors may concentrate on the implementation and evaluation of these proposed solutions in real-time operations, 
as well as the exploration of advanced predictive models for enhanced optimization. The research's impact and 
significance reside in its capacity to revolutionize RMC delivery processes, enhancing construction site management 
efficiency, and providing a scalable framework applicable to analogous industries worldwide.

Promoting Consumer Engagement in Sustainable Fashion 
and Circular Textile Through Eco-Gamification  
in Bangladesh 
Dibbo Das 
Department of Wet Processing Engineering 
Textile Engineering College (CTEC) 
Project Road, Zorarganj, Chittagong, Bangladesh 
dibbodasavi@gmail.com 
Sujoy Paul 
Department of Apparel Engineering 
Textile Engineering College (CTEC) 
Project Road, Zorarganj, Chittagong, Bangladesh 
sujoypaul.eng@gmail.com 
Abstract 
To keep up with the fast-paced era of fashion and trends, the textile and clothing (T&C) sector utilizes diverse methods 
to fulfill the expanding consumer needs. With the exceeding demand for textile goods, the fair share of environmental 
degradation is also rising due to the bulk waste produced by the textile and clothing factories. Bangladesh is analyzed 
in this research as a top textile maker to assess the effects of eco-gamification on buyers' behavior. Research in 
advanced nations shows how views on sustainability differ among different groups and places, and emphasizes the 
importance of specific studies in Bangladesh. We suggest combining gamification methods with a circular economy 
framework to motivate consumer interactions with businesses and consumers. This platform seeks to encourage 
sustainable practices including garment reuse and repair and recycling and offering them for reuse. Utilizing reward 
points for recycling or selling used products will encourage consumers to adopt sustainable habits and deliver real 
perks. The envisioned B2C2C economic framework intends to cut down on waste and lessen the use of resources to 
advance an environmentally friendly textile industry in Bangladesh. The platform rests on a decentralized framework 
to ensure the openness and security of transactions across blockchain technology. This model intends to alter 
purchasing patterns through excitement-generating rewards and build a more sustainable fashion landscape in 
Bangladesh and globally. 
Keywords: 
Eco-gamification, Sustainability, Textiles and Clothing, Circular Economy. 
1. Introduction:
An urgency exists to promote sustainable social structures according to Geissdoerfer et al. (2017). The global apparel 
market is growing and the textile industry caters to this need. Due to its demanding production process and fast fashion 
movement, the textile and apparel (T&C) sector generates significant waste and pollution. As global resource scarcity 
and climate change increase, the demand for sustainable practices in T&T is even more pressing. The fashion sector 
is trying to tackle environmental damage by adopting Circular Economy (SE) principles to reduce waste and extend 
the life of materials and products. According to the Ellen MacArthur Foundation, a circular textile system can be 
defined as "restorative and regenerative by design and providing benefits to business, society and the environment. A 
241
conclusion:
Proceedings of the  International Conference on Industrial Engineering and Operations Management  
£  IEOM Society International 
 Table 1. Awareness and Perceptions of Sustainable Fashion and Circular Textiles 
From the data, we can see the immense potential of gamification in influencing consumer behavior. Almost 92% of 
respondents are likely to change their purchasing habits if rewarded for eco-friendly actions, such as resharing, 
recycling, or donating clothes and 85% of respondents are not familiar with any existing platforms that offer rewards 
or incentives specifically for the reusability recycling of textile products. This represents a significant market gap that 
our proposed platform is well-positioned to fill. Our platform can establish itself as a first of its kind in this space for 
the target demographic, which is largely unaware of such initiatives. From the data, it is clear that the strong 
willingness of respondents (90%) to participate in any future platforms offering incentives for sustainable actions 
further highlights the demand for such an initiative. This underscores the crucial role that our proposed gamified 
platform could play in the entire region of sustainable textiles. Given the high likelihood of how people's behavior 
changes, implementing these new strategies could lead to significant shifts in how consumers engage with fashion, 
encouraging more sustainable choices. 
 
The satisfactory level of familiarity with sustainable fashion, mixed with a positive perception of circular textiles, 
suggests that initiatives like gamification will be well-received. Also, the lack of any existing alternatives provides an 
opportunity for the platform to take a leadership role in this space. By focusing on gamified incentives and targeted 
educational content, the platform has the potential to drive significant changes in consumer behavior, promoting 
sustainability and circularity in the fashion industry. 
 
Table 2.  Engagement Potential in Sustainable Platforms

8. Conclusion: 
This study highlights the game-based approach of eco-gamification towards consumer engagement in the sustainable 
fashion and circular textile sector in Bangladesh by encouraging both retailers and consumers to participate in more 
sustainable practices. Given the widespread awareness of sustainable fashion and the overall support for circular textile 
practices, this platform has quite a strong foundation to build upon. The initial idea is to build a unified platform that 
caters to their needs like the reuse, repair, and recycling of garments, while rewarding them for ticking the circular 
economy checkbox. Throughout this platform, both retailers and consumers would be actively involved with 
verification systems in place where transparency and reward-based eco-friendly actions will be promoted. This process

references:
Proceedings of the  International Conference on Industrial Engineering and Operations Management  
£  IEOM Society International 
will encourage participants to contribute to the circular economy by either purchasing used items or returning them 
for recycling, thus encouraging an environmentally responsible fashion cycle. 
 
This study has some limitations that warrant further exploration. Firstly, it focuses solely on the perspectives of a 
specific age group of urban Bangladeshi consumers and retailers, excluding a broader demographic. Future studies 
should explore the model of this study in a wider setting in terms of age group. Second, this study surveyed a sample 
of urban Bangladeshi consumers in certain areas. This approach did not encompass the perspectives of consumers in 
Bangladesh who did not live in those areas. Future research should expand to include diverse age groups and compare 
attitudes across urban and rural populations to capture a more comprehensive understanding of sustainable apparel 
consumption in Bangladesh. 
 
In summary, this study shows that ecogamification has the potential to realize a circular textile economy vision, 
providing real incentives for both consumers and retailers. Additionally, the platform could offer a more 
comprehensive solution that not only promotes sustainability through the active lifecycle of fashion but also addresses 
the environmental impact of discarded garments. This would enhance its role as a model for sustainable fashion 
practices in Bangladesh and beyond. By closing the loop between production, consumption, and recycling, the 
platform can contribute to a more sustainable fashion industry in Bangladesh, serving as a model for similar initiatives 
around the world.

abstract:

E-Commerce Market Maturity in Bangladesh: Future
Projection sand Strategic Framework for Startups
Md Monjur Hossain1, ABM Iftekher Ahmed1,  
Md Sazol Ahmmed1 and Moudud Ahmad1
1Department of Industrial & Production Engineering 
Rajshahi University of Engineering & Technology (RUET) 
Rajshahi, Bangladesh. 
Corresponding Author Email: monzoor.ruet@gmail.com 
Abstract 
The growing development of information technology has enhanced internet access, which has resulted in the growth 
of e-commerce—that is, buying and selling of goods and services on online platforms. Over the past 10 years, e-
commerce has been very popular since it offers consumers the simplicity of buying anyplace worldwide, running 
around-the-clock, and obtaining doorstep delivery. Bangladesh's mobile banking, ticket, ridesharing, online shopping, 
food delivery, etc. trends reflect this pattern. Many beginners, however, join the e-commerce scene without sufficient 
knowledge, which presents difficulties. Startups frequently have growing running expenses; hence competitive pricing 
is more challenging in the early and growing stages and leads to a high failure rate. Beginning with a study of 
Bangladesh's current e-commerce scenario, this research projects its future states using a Markov chain model. This 
also highlights the primary challenges e-commerce business owners must face. Furthermore, recommended 
specifically for Bangladeshi e-commerce companies is a perfect business structure to aid to ease these challenges. 
This structure aimed to lower operational costs in a competitive market therefore enhancing sustainability. This 
approach dramatically reduces startup failure rates and provides the foundation for innovative tech companies, 
therefore increasing Bangladesh's economic development in this technologically evolved era. 
Keywords 
Stochastic Markov Chain Model, Business Framework, Transition Matrix, Future States, Market Adoption Rate. 
1. Introduction
Bangladesh's e-commerce sector has experienced remarkable growth in recent years, emerging as one of the fastest-
growing markets in South Asia. By 2021, the market was valued at around $4 billion and is expected to reach $10 
billion by 2026, with an annual growth rate of 19.1%. (Statista 2021). According to the Bangladesh 
Telecommunication Regulatory, the country's internet adoption, with over 125.46 million users and 66 million active 
social media users, has been a key factor in fueling this growth. (BTRC 2021). As more consumers shift towards 
online shopping, this digital transformation reshapes the retail landscape, presenting opportunities and challenges for 
new eCommerce startups. As the market matures, the rapid growth seen in previous years is projected to slow, giving 
way to market saturation. By 2030, a big portion of the population is expected to have engaged in online shopping, 
leading to slower growth rates and expanded competition. In this changing landscape, startups need to develop long-
term strategies that can sustain growth, even as the market becomes more competitive and less welcoming to new 
players. 
This research employs a Markov Chain model to predict the adoption rates of the Bangladeshi e-commerce market 
from 2023 to 2030. By analyzing the transition probabilities between three key stages—Early Stage, Growth Stage, 
and Saturation Stage—this study provides a comprehensive forecast of the market's evolution over the next decade. 
The findings aim to offer actionable insights for e-commerce startups looking to navigate the increasingly competitive

5. Conclusion 
In Bangladesh's e-commerce sector early-stage adoption has declined significantly, from 26.5% to 0.2%, while the 
Saturation Stage has escalated from 0% to 42.6% which highlights the sector's progression from 2023 to 2030. This 
transition from quick growth to market saturation brings both prospects and hurdles for e-commerce companies, 
signaling that the industry is growing swiftly while approaching maturity. Newcomers need to adjust their focus from 
264
references:
Proceedings of the Industrial Engineering and Operations Management Bangladesh Conference 
aggressive growth toward sustainable development strategies. The proposed business framework supports a thoughtful 
response to this transformation and key elements include operational efficiency achieved through supply chain 
optimization and automation, customer retention strategies like loyalty programs and personalized experiences, and 
differentiation through a diverse value proposition. Companies leveraging data analytics and IOT can aim to enhance 
customer satisfaction and generate insightful data for better decision-making. In terms of sustainability, the strategy 
underscores the need for potential growth, allowing businesses to grow without compromising profitability. By 
focusing on these fundamentals, Bangladeshi e-commerce companies can adjust to the constantly changing landscape, 
fostering resilience and securing long-term success in an increasingly competitive market.

A Comprehensive Analysis of Mobile Phone Selection by 
Using MCDM Methods Throughout AHP, COPRAS, and 
TOPSIS on Assessment of Customer Preferences. 
Md. Mehedi Hasan Ridoy 
Department of Industrial & Production Engineering 
Rajshahi University of Engineering & Technology 
Rajshahi-6204,Bangladesh 
E-mail: ridoy.ruetipe19@gmail.com
Shadman Sakib 
Department of Industrial & Production Engineering 
Rajshahi University of Engineering & Technology 
Rajshahi-6204,Bangladesh 
E-mail: shadmansakibtanvin@gmail.com
Md. Ariful Islam 
Department of Industrial & Production Engineering 
Rajshahi University of Engineering & Technology 
Rajshahi-6204,Bangladesh 
E-mail: arifulislam@ipe.ruet.ac.bd
Abstract 
The objective of this research article is to select the optimal mobile model from the various options available in the 
market. For the purpose of this analysis, 24 different mobile models from various brands were chosen from several 
online shopping platforms, covering a range of specifications and prices from low to medium budget. An online and 
offline survey was conducted with Rajshahi City residents, encompassing students, engineers, salespeople, medical 
professionals, teachers, and other experts. The selection process is done based on 31 important criteria i.e. price, ROM, 
RAM, operating system brand value, camera quality, battery capacity, and so on. AHP was used to check data 
consistency, and SPSS was employed to verify data reliability. This selection process incorporates two MCDM tools: 
Complex Proportional Assessment (COPRAS) and Technique for Order of Preference by Similarity to Ideal Solution 
(TOPSIS). Applying individual COPRAS and TOPSIS methods, the best mobile is selected, with each process 
proposing its preference ranking order of the models. Comparing the proposed ranking orders by both methods shows 
that the outcomes are more or less identical, with minor changes in the middle-order rankings. Both processes give 
model 3 as the best among the 24 alternatives. 
Keywords 
MCDM, MOBILE-PHONE, AHP, COPRAS, TOPSIS. 
1. Introduction
Mobile phones have become a cornerstone of modern life, offering a range of functions that go beyond 
communication, such as internet browsing, photography, and entertainment. As the global smartphone market

6. Conclusion 
In this paper, we explore the complex world of consumer decision-making in the mobile phone industry, emphasizing 
the difficulties brought on by excessive options, technology breakthroughs, and users' differing degrees of technical 
expertise. The study emphasizes the importance of in-depth research to match user preferences with mobile phone 
features and avoid post-purchase discontent. Here We have to identify the best mobile phone selection based on criteria 
on their user performance order and also help the manufactured company brands understand the customer's 
performance order. Here, In the TOPSIS analysis, the Infinix Note 30 Pro (8/256) emerges as the top-performing 
mobile phone model, securing the first position. Similarly, in the COPRAS analysis, the Infinix Note 30 Pro maintains 
its position as the best-performing model, reaffirming its superiority. The rank for the 1st four models is indifferent in 
both the two methods. It means the accuracy of this ranking is strong and highly reliable. These approaches' ongoing 
development and improvement demonstrate their continuing significance in tackling modern decision difficulties in a 
variety of sectors and applications. The paper presents approaches and insights that are important for consumers and 
decision-makers in the ever-evolving environment of consumer preferences and technical breakthroughs, as the mobile 
phone business continues to change.

Aerodynamic Performance Analysis of NACA 4415 Airfoil 
Incorporating Gurney and Bionic Flap: A Steady-State 
Numerical Analysis 
Md Zisanul Haque Bhuiyan 
Graduate Student Research Assistant,  
Department of Mechanical Engineering, 
University of Michigan – Flint, MI, USA 
zisanul@umich.edu 
Md. Muqtadir Fuad, Masud Rana, A. S. M. Maruf Hasan,  
Khalid Ammar 
Undergraduate Student,  
Department of Industrial and Production Engineering (IPE)  
Bangladesh University of Engineering & Technology (BUET),  
Dhaka, Bangladesh 
2008079@ipe.buet.ac.bd, 1908046@ipe.buet.ac.bd,  
2008036@ipe.buet.ac.bd, 2008089@ipe.buet.ac.bd 
Abstract 
NACA 4415 is the most common and studied airfoil in aerodynamic studies. Incorporating flaps with NACA 4415 
airfoil is an effective way to improve aerodynamic performance and efficiency. This study presents a comparative 
numerical analysis among a standard model of NACA 4415 airfoil, modified NACA 4415 incorporating gurney flap, 
and NACA 4415 airfoil incorporating bionic flap based on the coefficient of lift and coefficient of drag at various 
angles of attack (AOA) (i.e. -15°, -10°, -5°,0°,5°,10°,15°) and flap height of 2% of the chord length. The airfoil 
performance was evaluated under a constant upstream velocity of 20 m/s using Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) 
simulations. The performance was measured based on lift coefficient over drag coefficient ratio and it is validated 
using velocity and pressure contour over the surface of the airfoil. The highest lift coefficient over drag coefficient 
ratio was found in the NACA 4415 airfoil incorporating a gurney flap, then the standard NACA 4415 airfoil and the 
least value of the ratio comes with the NACA 4415 airfoil incorporating a bionic flap. For instance, the Gurney flap 
made a big difference, boosting the lift-to-drag ratio by 49.9% at 0° AOA compared to the standard airfoil. Conversely, 
the bionic flap reduced this ratio by 19.86%. However, in every case, NACA 4415 airfoil with Gurney flap 
outperforms than other two airfoils in this study. Moreover, the velocity and pressure contour also support the result 
found from lift and drag coefficient. 
Keywords 
CFD, Bionic Flap, Gurney Flap, RANS, SIMPLE 
1. Introduction
In many engineering applications such as aviation, turbine technologies, and vehicle aerodynamics, airfoil 
aerodynamic performance is crucial. Increasing lift, reducing drag, and enhancing overall aerodynamic efficiency 
have been the subject of extensive research by optimizing the airfoil profile. The NACA 4415 airfoil, designed by the 
281
conclusion:
Proceedings of International Conference on Industrial Engineering and Operations Management  
© IEOM Society International 
\
 
(a) 
 
 
(b) 
 
(c)  
Figure 26. Comparison of NACA4415, NACA4415 with gurney flap, and NACA4415 with bionic flap respective to 
(a) Cl/Cd vs Angle of Attack (b) Lift Coefficient (Cl) vs Angle of Attack (c) Drag Coefficient (Cd) vs Angle of Attack 
 
6. Conclusion and Future Research 
The realizable 𝑘𝑘−𝜀𝜀 turbulent model was used in this study to analyze the aerodynamic performance of the NACA 4415 
Airfoil and its modifications with Gurney and bionic flaps at various attack angles (-15°, -10°, -5°, 0°, 5°, 10°, and 
15°). To find out how these changes influenced important aerodynamic characteristics such as the lift-to-drag ratio, 
velocity distribution, pressure distribution, and pressure coefficient, Ansys FLUENT was utilized. The NACA4415 
airfoil with the Gurney flap has achieved the highest lift-to-drag ratio, increasing 49.9% above the conventional airfoil 
at 00 AOA. This demonstrates greater aerodynamic efficiency. In contrast, the bionic flap reduced the Cl/Cd ratio by 
19.86% at the same angle of attack, indicating that it is less effective in applications that favor lift. The gurney flap 
exhibited low trailing edge separation, providing improved lift generation across all AOAs. NACA 4415 with a bionic 
flap has the lowest separation. It may be ideal for stability-focused designs, such as airplanes or UAVs, which require 
consistent performance in a variety of flying circumstances. The Gurney flap increased pressure at the trailing edge, 
which facilitated increasing lift by using trailing edges. In contrast, the bionic flap had a more uniform pressure 
distribution at negative AOAs, resulting in less lift. For both the bionic flap and the normal airfoil, lift was primarily 
produced at the leading edge. 
 
The pressure coefficient distribution of the NACA 4415 airfoil and with gurney and bionic flap designs varies 
significantly with angle of attack (AOA). Lower lift at negative AOAs is caused by negative pressure on the lower 
surface and positive pressure on the top surface. The lower surface is under higher pressure when there are positive 
AOAs, so they produce more lift. The pressure differential coefficient was also found to be substantially smaller at 
the trailing edge than it is at the leading edge, despite being substantially larger there.In conclusion, the modified 
NACA4415 airfoil with Gurney flaps exhibits remarkable aerodynamic performance, suggesting it is for application 
295
references:
Proceedings of International Conference on Industrial Engineering and Operations Management  
© IEOM Society International 
in high lift applications like wind turbines and unmanned aerial vehicles. The bionic flap efficiently reduces flow 
separation, but it also lowers lift; this suggests that it could be useful in situations where control and stability are more 
crucial than lift efficiency. When the angle of attack (AOA) was more than 100, the lift showed a decreasing trend. 
So, further research can be conducted with higher AOA which leads to determine the flow separation angle. Moreover, 
flap length also has a considerable effect on lift and drag. By varying flap length, optimal design can be obtained in 
the future.

Implementation of TQM Tools for Enhancing Quality: A 
Case Study in the Ready-Made Garment  
Sector of Bangladesh

A H M Abdul Moudood

Dhaka 1230, Bangladesh

Abstract 
Total Quality Management (TQM) is a quality management tool for improving quality by addressing issues related to 
the entire production process. It involves the process of detecting wastes occurred on a regular basis to improve the 
product quality to increase customer satisfaction. This paper has explored the application of TQM tools to identify 
defects in the sewing line of garment industries and address such issues using Standard Operating Procedures (SOP). 
298

© IEOM Society International 
Analysis from the before and after evaluation of implementing SOP  
We can see that the 5S scores for oil spots has improved after SOP implementation in the sewing line of polo t-shirt 
from 4 to 9, showing a visible reduction in occurrence of oil spots now as regular and consistent cleaning routines are 
maintained now.  
 
The 5S score went from 5 to 8 for pleats, showcasing a better fabric handling and machine adjustments to prevent 
unintentional pleats during the production of a polo t-shirt.  
 
The score increased from 5 to 9 for raw edges after the SOP implementation, showing that proper seam allowances 
and overlock machine usage have effectively minimized raw edges.  
 
The score improved from 4 to 9, indicating how consistent needle maintenance and thread tension checks have reduced 
open stitches.

6. Conclusion: 
This study highlights the effectiveness of applying Total Quality Management (TQM) tools, like check sheets, 
histograms, Pareto analysis, and Cause-Effect diagrams chronologically to find the root causes and then taking action 
against them to improve the quality of polo t-shirt production by reducing defects and increasing efficiency through 
the implementation of SOPs. The actions taken against the identified major causes has shown significant improvement 
as the rework and wastes has reduced quite drastically. Besides this SOP application has reduced all non-productive 
activities in the sewing line which can be seen clearly from the before and after 5S score evaluation as the 5S has score 
has went from 102 to 163 after this. Though this research was limited to a single product which is a polo t-shirt and 
its production setting, and focused mainly on the sewing line, future studies could be expanded in to other garment 
types by including multiple production cycles, and integrate digital systems for real-time monitoring. Besides 
exploring the impact of employee training on sustaining quality improvements could also provide valuable insights 
for long term success in garment manufacturing.

Optimizing Management Processes: Integrating Generative AI 
to Bridge Gaps in Project, Engineering, and Construction 
Management Skills. 
Md. Aharap Shahriar Anik 
M.Sc. Engg. (Enrolled) in DRR, B.Sc. in Civil Engineering,
Bangladesh University of Engineering & Technology (BUET)
Dhaka-1000, Bangladesh 
anik440buet@gmail.com 
Abstract 
The infrastructure development teams often face persistent challenges in effectively integrating project management, 
engineering management, and construction management skills. This often leads to misalignment of goals, 
miscommunication, and a lack of understanding between different teams. This paper explores the potential of 
generative AI (GenAI) to bridge these skill gaps and optimize management processes. By examining the capabilities 
of GenAI and analysing real-world case studies, we demonstrate how this technology can empower professionals to 
seamlessly transition between distinct roles and responsibilities. The findings highlight GenAI's transformative impact 
on enhancing efficiency, collaboration, and decision-making across the project lifecycle. The implications of GenAI 
for organizational reformation is also discussed in this paper with a focus on fostering a culture of innovation and 
sustainability in the infrastructure development.  
Keywords 
Project Management, Engineering Management, Construction Management, Skill Gaps, Generative AI, 
Interdisciplinary Collaboration, Reformation, Sustainability, Innovation. 
Introduction 
In the realm of contemporary industrial practices, effective management of complex projects is essential for success. 
Within this context, the combination of project management, engineering management, and construction management 
abilities is paramount. However, effectively combining these skillsets habitually presents challenges, leading to 
misaligned goals, communication breakdowns, and a lack of understanding between different teams. This paper delves 
into the transformative potential of generative artificial intelligence (GenAI) to bridge these skill gaps and optimize 
management processes. Genai, an innovative technology, has emerged as a game-changer in various fields, and its 
potential applications in construction management are vast and promising. By analysing the capabilities of GenAI and 
examining real-world case studies, this paper aims to demonstrate how this technology can empower professionals to 
seamlessly transition between different roles and responsibilities. The findings highlight GenAI's profound impact on 
enhancing efficiency, promoting collaboration, and improving decision-making throughout the entire project lifecycle. 
1.1 Background 
In the contemporary landscape of industrial practices, effective project management is essential for achieving success. 
However, the construction industry faces persistent challenges in effectively integrating the distinct disciplines of 
Project Management, Engineering Management, and Construction Management. This misalignment often leads to 
gaps in communication, expertise, and decision-making, hindering project success as described below: 
310
conclusion:
Proceedings of the International Conference on Industrial Engineering and Operations Management, 
hardware, and training, can be prohibitive, especially for companies operating in a developing economy like 
Bangladesh. 
Data and Infrastructure Limitations: 
Data Quality and Infrastructure: Successful AI implementation requires high-quality data and reliable infrastructure 
for data collection and processing, which many companies in Bangladesh lack (Ghimire et al., 2023). The availability 
of reliable data and the necessary infrastructure for data management can be a challenge in Bangladesh, limiting the 
effectiveness of GenAI applications. 
Quality and Availability of Data: AI systems necessitate extensive amounts of quality data, which can be difficult to 
obtain in the construction industry due to fragmented and inconsistent data sources (Ghimire et al., 2023). In 
Bangladesh, the deficiency of standardized data collection and management practices can further exacerbate this 
challenge. 
Technological and Skill-Related Barriers: 
Rework and Waste: A massive portion of construction costs goes to rework due to errors and omissions, which AI 
aims to reduce but requires substantial digitization efforts (Ghimire et al., 2023). The digitization of construction 
processes and the adoption of AI technologies can be challenging in Bangladesh, where traditional practices and 
manual processes are still prevalent. 
Slow Adoption: Despite recent advancements, the construction industry has been slow to implement modern 
technologies, including GenAI, due to traditional practices and resistance to change (Ghimire et al., 2023). This 
resistance to change can hinder the adoption of GenAI, even when its potential benefits are evident. 
Incorporation with Existing Systems: Incorporating GenAI with current construction management systems and 
workflows can be complex and costly (Ghimire et al., 2023). The lack of interoperability between different systems 
and the need for customized integration solutions can be a barrier to GenAI adoption in Bangladesh. 
Skill Gap: There is a lack of professionals with the essential expertise to create, install, and maintain AI systems in 
construction. (Ghimire et al., 2023). In Bangladesh, the lack of skilled professionals in AI and related fields can hinder 
the effective adoption and utilization of GenAI technologies. 
Other Challenges: 
Awareness and Understanding: There is limited awareness and understanding of GenAI technologies among 
construction professionals in Bangladesh. This lack of awareness can hinder the adoption of GenAI, even when its 
potential benefits are clear. 
Regulatory and Legal Framework: The absence of a clear regulatory and legal framework for AI in Bangladesh can 
create uncertainty and hinder the adoption of GenAI technologies. 
Addressing these difficulties requires a concerted effort from different stakeholders, including the government, 
industry associations, educational institutions, and construction enterprises. By investing in infrastructure 
development, skill-building initiatives, and awareness campaigns, Bangladesh can create a more conducive 
environment for embracing and utilization of GenAI in the construction sector. 
6.Conclusion
This study has explored the potential of GenAI to address the gaps and optimize management processes. By examining 
the capabilities of GenAI and analyzing real-world case studies and expert opinions, we have demonstrated how this 
technology can empower professionals to seamlessly transition between different roles and responsibilities, enhance 
communication and collaboration, improve decision-making, and promote sustainability. The findings highlight 
GenAI's transformative impact on the modern infrastructures, suggesting a future in which AI-driven solutions are 
essential to effective and sustainable project management. 
The mixed-methods approach used in this study, combining literature review, industry focus group discussions, and 
questionnaires, has offered useful insights into the prospective uses. and challenges of GenAI in construction 
management. The mapping of multiple GenAI model types to diverse building jobs has emphasized the flexibility and 
adaptability of this technology. The positive perception of GenAI's potential among industry professionals underscores 
the growing interest and acceptance of AI-driven solutions in the construction sector. 
319
references:
Proceedings of the International Conference on Industrial Engineering and Operations Management,  
However, the study also acknowledges the limitations and challenges of GenAI implementation, including the need 
for domain knowledge, addressing the risk of hallucinations, ensuring accuracy and generalizability, and managing 
ethical and regulatory considerations. Overcoming these challenges will require a collaborative effort from industry 
experts, researchers, and legislators to develop responsible and effective integration strategies. 
In conclusion, GenAI presents a unique opportunity to redefine and optimize management processes in the 
construction industry. By embracing this technology and addressing its challenges, the construction industry can move 
towards a more efficient, sustainable, and innovative future. The insights and recommendations presented in this paper 
serve as a valuable guide for researchers, practitioners, and policymakers to navigate the transformative potential of 
GenAI in construction.

abstract:

Publisher: IEOM Society International, USA 
Published: December 21, 2024
